data.title: Possible weddings for the granddaughters of Queen Victoria
data.meta_description: In her book Born To Rule the writer Julia P. Geraldi tells the story of the 5 granddaughters of Victoria who became Queens - In another scenario as we could...
data.text:
I definitely loved this thread although I have some questions

1- I think that Victoria and Christian could get married in 1891 - since he marrying 16 would be unlikely

2- I would like to see Maud with a more important role in this scenario haha marrying Nicolas II in 1889

3 - Victoria Melita could have married Haakon instead of maud - They could marry in 1894 - he could be chosen king of Norway before 1905, perhaps in 1893, which would motivate him to get married early

4- Alberto of Belgium could form a beautiful couple with Margaret of Connaught - 1899

5 - Alice could marry Maximilian of Baden - 1889

6 - Beatriz Saxe Coburg could marry the prince heir of Wurttemberg (1878) in 1902

Some marriages I had never thought of and even with different religions could be very pleasing as =

Louise Wales - Carlos I of Portugal

Helena Victoria - Victor Emanuel III - Maybe I would advance the marriage of Helena Victoria and Victor Emanuel to 1891

Marie Louise - Frederick August III - They would certainly be a couple in love

I definitely loved this thread although I have some questions

Thanks for the appreciation

1- I think that Victoria and Christian could get married in 1891 - since he marrying 16 would be unlikely

I was just showing the youngest so these two marrying later is fine.

2- I would like to see Maud with a more important role in this scenario haha marrying Nicolas II in 1889

Thats fair enought, I only kept her with Harold as she quickly to adapt to her new country and duties as Queen Consort of Norway, as well as playing a strong and dominant role within the court and family.

3 - Victoria Melita could have married Haakon instead of maud - They could marry in 1894 - he could be chosen king of Norway before 1905, perhaps in 1893, which would motivate him to get married early

Yer thats true.

4- Alberto of Belgium could form a beautiful couple with Margaret of Connaught - 1899

Again this works

5 - Alice could marry Maximilian of Baden - 1889

I avoided Baden due to its lack of power not only one the world stage but even in the German sphere.

6 - Beatriz Saxe Coburg could marry the prince heir of Wurttemberg (1878) in 1902

Prince Heir is fine as well.

Some marriages I had never thought of and even with different religions could be very pleasing as =

Louise Wales - Carlos I of Portugal

Helena Victoria - Victor Emanuel III - Maybe I would advance the marriage of Helena Victoria and Victor Emanuel to 1891

Marie Louise - Frederick August III - They would certainly be a couple in love

It's not completely outragous of a British princess converting to Catholicism, as I stated that IOTL Princess Victoria Eugenie of Battenberg did marry Catholic King Alfonso XIII of Spain as well as Princess Beatrice of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha marrying Infante Alfonso, Duke of Galliera.
